definition: to collapse (of building, dam or bridge)
to collapse/to break or wear down/to defeat

sentences.english: The ceiling had collapsed, blocking a path to the tunnel opening.
sentences.chinese: 顶板垮塌下来，堵塞了通往道口的通道。

sentences.english: Rarely ifever does a country's savings rate collapse quickly after reaching such a highlevel.
sentences.chinese: 达到这样一个水平后很少有国家的储蓄率快速垮塌。

sentences.english: More than 3.46 million houses were wracked, Li said.
Even without landslides, post-earthquake pictures show collapsed houses sliding downhill.
sentences.chinese: 即使没有滑坡，震后照片现实垮塌的房屋顺山坡滑下。

sentences.english: Those types of piles are created when parking garages and skyscrapers collapse.
sentences.chinese: 这些瓦砾堆主要由立体车库和摩天大楼垮塌形成。

sentences.english: Several pancaked cars are visible under the collapsed ground floor.
sentences.chinese: 在垮塌的首层废墟之下能看到几辆被压成薄饼的汽车。

sentences.english: The dragon somersaulted; the land collapsed;

definition: talus slide/to crumble (of scree slope)/to collapse/landslide
talus slide/to crumble (of scree slope)/to collapse/landslide
old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
subsidence/caving in/fig. stranded/lost (in contemplation, daydreams etc)
